sections.heading: What is FSSAI?
content: The Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI) is the official body that sets and enforces food safety, quality, and hygiene standards in India. All food businesses must register with FSSAI or get a license to operate legally.

points: Legal compliance — All food businesses must follow the law
Customer trust & brand credibility — FSSAI logo and number show quality
Eligibility for marketplaces & export — Required for platforms like Swiggy, Amazon, and export markets
Avoid penalties — Operating without FSSAI can lead to fines and business closure

list.title: Basic Registration
points: For small businesses with turnover less than ₹12 lakh
Must be displayed on packaging or at business location

list.title: State License
points: For turnover between ₹12 lakh and ₹20 crore
Issued by State Food Safety Department

list.title: Central License
points: For turnover above ₹20 crore or multi-state operations
Application: Form B via central authority
Determine your category based on turnover and business scope
Register on the FoSCoS portal (official FSSAI portal)
Submit Form A (Basic) or Form B (State/Central) with documents
Application is verified by the authority and license/registration is issued

list.title: Basic Registration
points: Proof of identity (Aadhaar, Voter ID, Passport, PAN)
Optional: Rent agreement or NOC from property owner

list.title: State License
points: Photo ID and address proof of owner/partners/directors
Partnership deed / LLP agreement / MOA & AOA if applicable
Additional: Trade license, GST certificate, Import-Export Code if applicable

list.title: Central License
points: Photo ID and address proof of promoters/directors
Documents for transporters, warehouses, and exporters
FSSAI number (14 digits) must be displayed on food packaging, menus, invoices, and business premises
Renew license at least 30 days before expiry to avoid fines
Maintain proper records for inspections and audits
All food businesses must register under FSSAI, including home kitchens and online sellers
Running a business without FSSAI can lead to fines up to ₹5 lakh, business closure, and legal action
Category choice (Basic, State, Central) depends on turnover and scope
Basic registration takes 7-10 working days, State license 15-30 days, Central license 25-45 days
FSSAI license validity: 1–5 years depending on registration
Renewal required at least 30 days before expiry
Upgrades from Basic to State/Central possible as business grows
Inspection may be needed for State/Central licenses
